intro: Alsine bracteata, commonly known as the bracted alsike, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in prairies and along roadsides. It produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it is often mistaken for other members of the alsike genus.
